page.title: 20WORK & LEISURE IN ROCK FERRY
page.content: The area is served by one{Sports {hall/Swimming Pool}which was built in 1933. This is used by schools during the day but is open to clubs during the evenings and holiday times. A wide range of activities are offered and well used. There is the{Viking {Boys Club}opposite the school and an adventure play area. There is one {Roman Catholic,}one{Baptist}and one {Anglican Church}in the area. There does not seem to be any{ethnic problem in the community. The{Chinese,}who run the{take-away food shops,}have their own way of life and language but the children are well accepted at school. Those who are fortunate enough to have a job tend to work outside the area or have part-time jobs. Rock Ferry is a typical area suffering from urban decay with a degree of crime and drabness.
